description: A Romano-British cemetery including a masonry tower, this has been interpreted as a mausoleum, or a shrine.
bibliography: Johnson. “A Roman Signal Tower at Shadwell, E1.” Transactions of the London and Middlesex Archaeological Society 26 (1975).
Lakin. “The Roman Tower at Shadwell, London: A Reappraisal.” Museum of London Archaeology Service Archaeology Studies Series 8 (2002).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Shadwell, The Highway (Greater London).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
